title: 820-3437-B - No display after removing shorted C5002 on PP3V42_G3H, which restored Magsafe light and fan.
message:
Hi all.
Macbook Air A1466 with a 820-3437-B Logic board.

Bought in as not powering on, no lights, display, chimes or fans.
No evidence of liquid ingress - very dusty though.

Found shorted C5002 on PP3V42_G3H rail.

Removed and that restored Magsafe light and fan- still no chime and no display on internal or external monitor.
SMC reset changes magsafe light.
PRAM reset turns unit on, but doesn't seem to do anything else.

[B]Is C5002 vital to functionality?[/B]

I've checked out the voltages of various rails, while the unit was powered on, with battery and display connected. .


PPBUS_G3H 8.3V
PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS 8.3V
PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS 8.3V

PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL 20.0V
PPDCIN_G3H 20V

PP2V42_G3H 3.42V
PPVRTC_G3H 3.3V
PP5V_S4RS3 5.2V
PP5V_S0 5.2V

PP3V3_S5 3.3V
PP3V3_S4 3.3V
PP3V3_SUS 3.3V
PP3V3_S3 3.3V
PP3V3_S0 3.3V
PP3V3_S4SW_SNS 3.3V
PP3V3_S0SW_SSD 3.3V
PP3V3_S4_TBTAPWR 3.3V

PP1V8_S3 1.87V
PP1V2_S3 1.2V
PP1V05_SUS 1.1V
PP1V5_S0 1.5V
PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT 0.6V
PP1V05_S0 1.1V
PP1V05_S0SW_PCH_HSIO 1V

[COLOR=rgb(184, 49, 47)][B]PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT 0V[/B][/COLOR][B] (Should be 50v?) (Diode mode to ground reads 0.557)[/B]
[COLOR=rgb(184, 49, 47)][B]PP15V_TBT 0V[/B][/COLOR][B] (Should be 15-17.8v?) (Diode mode to ground reads 0.518)[/B]
PP3V3_TBTLC 3.3V
PP1V05_TBTLC 1.1V
PP1V05_TBTCIO 1.1V
[COLOR=rgb(184, 49, 47)][B]PPVIN_S4SW_TBTBST_FET 0V[/B][/COLOR][B] ( Should be 8.6v) (Diode mode to ground reads 0.451)[/B]
PPVCC_S0_CPU 1.8V

[B]Any suggestions as to where to go from here?[/B]
Thanks.

title: 820-3437-B - No display after removing shorted C5002 on PP3V42_G3H, which restored Magsafe light and fan.
message:
My first suggestion, do not waste time checking voltage for same power rail in different points.
Next suggestion, do not check Thunderbolt area without connecting corresponding device.
Same as for backlight; searching backlight/image on a board which does not even boot???

Missing C5002 is not the reason of your problem; replace it anyway.
If it was corroded, reball SMC.

Check SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and traces.
Also clean J6100.
Try known good BIOS.

PLT_RESET_L goes high?

title: 820-3437-B - No display after removing shorted C5002 on PP3V42_G3H, which restored Magsafe light and fan.
message:
Hi again 2informaticos.

Thanks for your suggestions... I'm still learning, as you can probably tell. :)
All good points you make.
I posted all those different voltages in case you wanted them, to save time... but yes... that was a waste of time, lol.

I'll find another C5002 equivalent from a dead board and replace it.
No signs of corrosion anywhere.

All the SPI Bus Series Termination resistors measure correct resistance.

However, SPI_CLK and SPI_MOSI both show zero volts.
The two other SPI lines, SPI_MISO and SPI_CS both show 3.3 volts.

Another thing I noticed is R6102 should be 100K Ohms resistance, but shows as only 65.5-74 KOhms.
However, I did test another, admittedly unknown faulty board, and the R6102 on that one was 74K

I cleaned J6100, despite it looking pristine.

PLT_RESET_L goes to 3.35 volts

I'll have a look for the same board to get a BIOS chip off, but thought I'd post this data in the meantime.

title: 820-3437-B - No display after removing shorted C5002 on PP3V42_G3H, which restored Magsafe light and fan.
message:
Sorry for the delay.
I had to put this on the backburner for a bit.

OK, I replaced the BIOS chip from another 820-3437-B, and no change. :(
I did notice the CPU is getting very hot.
Still no display internal or external.
SMC reset cycles Magsafe light, power button starts and stops system....

title: 820-3437-B - No display after removing shorted C5002 on PP3V42_G3H, which restored Magsafe light and fan.

820-3437-B - No display after removing shorted C5002 on PP3V42_G3H, which restored Magsafe light and fan.
message:
Ah. OK.
I think thats probably the most likely.
I'll move on.
Thanks for your help and advice, 2informaticos, I do appreciate it.
